etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Nicholson (1844–1899), biologist and geologist. From scientific Latin Monticulipora, genus name + -oid

definitions: Of or relating to the genus Monticulipora or related genera of massive stony colonial bryozoans found as fossils from early Palaeozoic times.

notes.text: In the 19th century monticuliporoids were widely believed to be corals, but are now recognized as bryozoans, chiefly of the stenolaemate order Trepostomata.

definitions: A bryozoan of the group typified by the genus Monticulipora.
